title: Health Minister visits Anuradhapura Hospital after doctor assault
byline: Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa  visited the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital this morning and held a special meeting with the hospital’s medical team, including the Director and Deputy Director, to discuss the sexual assault on a female doctor at the facility.

title: Ukraine ready to accept 30-day ceasefire with Russia
byline: Ukraine has said it is ready to accept an immediate 30-day ceasefire with Russia proposed by the US, after a day of US-Ukraine talks in Saudi Arabia.

title: Suspect arrested in Anuradhapura doctor rape case
byline: The suspect wanted in connection with the alleged rape of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital has been arrested.

title: More than 100 passengers rescued from Pakistan train attack
byline: Armed militants in Pakistan’s Balochistan region have attacked a train carrying more than 400 passengers and taken a number of them hostage, military sources told the BBC on Tuesday.

title: Manhunt underway to arrest suspect who raped lady doctor
byline: A manhunt is underway for a suspect who allegedly raped a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital.

title: Health Minister urges media to respect victim’s privacy
byline: Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa urged all print and digital media to respect the privacy of the lady doctor involved in the unfortunate incident at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital by refraining from disclosing her identity.

title: Not satisfied with speech written to me by my officials: Lal Kantha
byline: Minister of Agriculture K.D. Lal Kantha said he decided to make his own speech today instead of the one which was written for him by his Ministry officials.

title: Pope Francis shows slight improvements in overall complex medical picture
byline: Pope Francis’ clinical situation remains stable with doctors confirming slight improvements within a context that nevertheless remains complex.

title: Take legal action against former Speaker, Deputy Speaker: Leader of the House
byline: Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayke today requested Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne to look into the possibility of taking action against his predecessor Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena,  former Deputy Speaker Ajith Rajapaksa and former Deputy Chairman of Committees Angajan Ramanathan for alleged excessive use of fuel during their tenures.

title: Despite arrest, doctors to continue strike
byline: Medical officers have decided to continue with their strike action despite the arrest of the suspect wanted in connection with the alleged rape of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital.

title: Female politician fled to New Zealand after graveside threat
byline: An aspiring Sri Lankan politician - who was sidelined because she was a woman - found her house surrounded by gunmen, and was also a victim of sextortion, a tribunal has heard.

title: Govt. receives over 40 tonnes of paddy as farmers shift gears
byline: Despite initial reluctance and grievances from farmers regarding selling paddy to the government, the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) has purchased paddy amounting to 42,124 kg paddy from the farmers.

title: Passenger arrested for alleged sexual assault on flight from Mumbai
byline: A passenger on a SriLankan Airlines flight from Mumbai to Katunayake Airport has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting passengers and flight attendants.

title: Deadline for postal vote applications extended
byline: The Election Commission announced that the deadline for submitting applications to cast postal votes in the 2025 Local Government (LG) Elections has been extended till March 17 at 12:00 midnight.

title: UNPer protests against presence of Rajitha at Sirikotha
byline: Former MP and an organiser for the Kalutara District, Lakshman Wijemanne protested against MP Rajitha Senaratne’s presence at the party headquarters Sirikotha during a ceremony held to handover appointment letters to new organisers.

title: Court of Appeal reserves order on Deshabandu’s Writ petition for March 17
byline: The Court of Appeal today reserved its order on the writ petition filed by Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon until March 17.

title: Govt. urges doctors to call off strike; says it is unreasonable
byline: Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa today urged the doctors’ trade unions to call off their strike, calling it unreasonable as the government is taking steps to ensure security for doctors and provide necessary facilities.

title: Krrish Case: Namal’s counsel accuses CIABOC of political witch-hunt
byline: The Fort Magistrate ordered the Bribery Commission to file a report before court on their investigations on March 26 over the Krrish Real Estate Funds misappropriation  by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s son Namal Rajapaksa.

title: China to establish Tai Chi, Dragon Boat Racing in Sri Lanka
byline: The Chinese government announced today that it will support the establishment and development of sports, including Tai Chi and Dragon Boat racing, in Sri Lanka.

title: Court grants bail to passenger arrested for attempting to sexually harass flight attendants
byline: The passenger who was arrested for allegedly attempting to sexually harass two SriLankan Airlines flight attendants, was released on two sureties of Rs. 100,000 each by Colombo Chief Magistrate Tanuja Lakmali today.

title: Drug addiction among Sri Lankan youth on the rise, warns National Drugs Board
byline: The National Dangerous Drugs Control Board has expressed growing concern over the escalating drug addiction issue among youth in Sri Lanka.

title: First school term ends on Friday
byline: The first phase of the first school term for government and government-approved private schools in 2025 will end this Friday (14), the Education Ministry announced.

title: No procurement guidelines followed when purchases made for MR’s official residence renovation
byline: Startling revelations have now emerged how building materials for the renovation of Mahinda Rajapaksa’s official residence have been purchased from selected suppliers on the direction of the Project Engineer Lt. Com. Aravinda of the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Amazon forest felled to build road for climate summit
byline: A new four-lane highway cutting through tens of thousands of acres of protected Amazon rainforest is being built for the COP30 climate summit in the Brazilian city of Belém.

title: Australian man survives 100 days with artificial heart in world-first success
byline: Sydney surgeons ‘enormously proud’ after patient in his 40s receives the Australian-designed implant designed as a bridge before donor heart

title: SJB MP proposes to offer cash to people who capture toque monkeys
byline: Opposition MP Sujith Sanjaya Perera today proposed the government to offer at least Rs. 500 or Rs. 1,000 in cash to people who capture toque monkeys as a solution to the crop damage caused by animals.

title: Tenth Executive President of Sri Lanka will emerge from UNP before long: Wajira
byline: The tenth Executive President of Sri Lanka will emerge from UNP before long, UNP Chairman Wajira Abeywardana said today.
